workouts.description: Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 6-8 x 400m repeats at fast pace with 2 min easy jog recovery between intervals, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Focus on controlled speed and recovery.
Complete rest day. Prioritize recovery and good sleep.
Gentle, conversational pace. Focus on keeping heart rate low (Zone 2) to ensure true aerobic development and recovery. If necessary, incorporate short walk breaks to lower HR.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 20 minutes at a comfortably hard pace, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). The tempo portion should feel challenging but sustainable.
Complete rest day. Focus on hydration and light stretching if desired.
Steady, conversational pace. Maintain a true easy effort throughout to build endurance without undue stress. Listen to your body and slow down if needed.
Active recovery, such as a gentle 30-minute walk, light stretching, or yoga. No running today.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 8-10 x 400m repeats at faster pace with 90 sec easy jog recovery, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Aim for consistent effort.
Complete rest day. Focus on quality sleep.
Gentle, conversational pace. Continue focusing on low heart rate. This run is for recovery and aerobic base.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 25 minutes at a comfortably hard pace, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Extend the sustained effort from last week.
Complete rest day. Light stretching or foam rolling if beneficial.
Steady, conversational pace. Extend the distance slightly while maintaining true easy effort. Practice fueling if desired.
Active recovery, such as a gentle 30-40 minute walk, or gentle cross-training like cycling or swimming.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 5-6 x 600m repeats at strong pace with 2 min easy jog recovery, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Longer repeats to build speed endurance.
Complete rest day. Prioritize nutrition and rest.
Gentle, conversational pace. A shorter easy run to facilitate recovery after speed work.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 30 minutes at a comfortably hard pace, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Longest tempo run to challenge endurance at speed.
Complete rest day. Focus on relaxation.
Steady, conversational pace. This is your longest run of the plan so far. Focus on consistent effort and true easy pace.
Active recovery, such as a gentle 30-40 minute walk, stretching, or light mobility work.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 8-10 x 300m repeats at faster pace with 90 sec easy jog recovery, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Shorter, faster intervals to work on top-end speed.
Complete rest day. This week incorporates a mini-taper, so prioritize rest.
Very gentle, conversational pace. Keep it short and focused on feeling fresh for upcoming workouts.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 20 minutes at a comfortably hard pace, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Slightly reduced tempo duration for recovery.
Complete rest day. Mental and physical rest are key.
Medium-long run at a steady, conversational pace. Reduced from last week to allow for recovery and adaptation.
Active recovery or complete rest based on how you feel. Focus on nourishing your body.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 3-4 x 800m repeats at current 10k race pace or slightly faster with 2-3 min easy jog recovery, Cool-down (10 min easy jog). Simulates sustained race effort.
Complete rest day. Enjoy the break and recover.
Very gentle, short, conversational pace. This is a shake-out run, keeping legs loose.
Warm-up (10 min easy jog), 15 min progression run starting easy and gradually speeding up to a moderate effort, Cool-down (5 min easy jog). Focus on feeling strong and controlled.
Complete rest day. Prepare mentally for your final long run.
Your longest run of the plan, at a steady, conversational pace. Focus on maintaining true easy effort and building confidence in your endurance.
Active recovery or complete rest. Reflect on your progress and plan next steps.
